name: Number Sorter CLI
description: A command-line application that sorts numbers in ascending order
user_prompt:
You are an autonomous software engineer. Build and test a Go command-line number sorter.

REQUIREMENTS:
- Accept numbers as CLI args: ./sorter 12 34 13
- Sort the numbers in ascending order
- Print the sorted numbers to stdout, space-separated on a single line
- Exit 0 on success, 1 on error
- Handle invalid input (non-numeric values) gracefully

EXAMPLES (must pass):
  ./sorter 12 34 13       → 12 13 34
  ./sorter 5 2 8 1 9     → 1 2 5 8 9
  ./sorter 42            → 42
  ./sorter 10 5 5 3      → 3 5 5 10
  ./sorter -5 0 10       → -5 0 10

YOUR AUTONOMOUS WORKFLOW:
1. Create main.go with number sorter implementation
2. Write test cases (as Go tests or shell commands)
3. Run your tests
4. Fix any failures
5. Build the sorter binary: go build -o sorter .

DO NOT ask for permission or clarification. You have full authority to:
- Choose any implementation (sort package, custom sorting, etc.)
- Write comprehensive tests
- Iterate and debug
- Make design decisions

EXPECTED OUTPUT:
- main.go (working implementation)
- sorter (compiled binary, this must be done for our cicd test suite, `go build -o sorter .`)
- Test results showing all tests pass

START NOW. Build the number sorter.

expected_files.main.go: Go source file with number sorter implementation

cli_tests.description: Sorting many numbers with multiple duplicates
Sorting large positive and negative numbers
